issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Allow repeating job commit by extending OutputCommitter API

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

{code}
I ran git bisect and detected that MAPREDUCE-5485 broke the test.
Upload a quick fix to test failure.

The previous failure is because since MAPREDUCE-5485, we allow MR job can retry on AM failure during committing stage (if Committer is repeatable). So MRAppMaster.initAndStartAppMaster() won't throw fatal exception if there are commit start file exists (which hints previous AM failed in the middle of commit) for FileOutputCommitter which is default for version 2 algorithm in trunk. I think we don't need this fix in branch-2 as the version in branch-2 is 1.

LGTM. Thanks [~djp] for the quick response.
Now I cannot reproduce the failure of {{testMRAppMasterSuccessLock}}. Hi [~varun_saxena] and [~ozawa], is the failure still a problem?

bq. -1	asflicense	0m 24s	Patch generated 7 ASF License warnings.
TestMRAppMaster is using directory other than {{test.build.data}}, so the intermediate files are checked by Apache Rat. We should fix it in a separate jira.
I'm checking by running the test case. Please wait a moment.
+1. Test passes for me.

bq. TestMRAppMaster is using directory other than test.build.data, so the intermediate files are checked by Apache Rat. We should fix it in a separate jira.
Agree. The worse thing is the test doesn't cleanup the directory in the end because the cleanup() get called before every tests rather than after. Let's file a separate JIRA to fix them.

bq. We should fix it in a separate jira.
This issue is tracked by MAPREDUCE-6557.
Thanks [~djp] for the comment. Updated the patch to cleanup the test dir after the tests.
My mistake. I attached the patch to the wrong jira. Deleting the patch.

bq. I'm checking by running the test case. Please wait a moment.
The Jenkins test report above already show it. Isn't it?

Jenkins CI looks to be checking another patch. +1 for MAPREDUCE-6555.patch. Checking this in.
Committed this to trunk. Thanks [~djp] for the contribution and [~ajisakaa] and [~varun_saxena] for the review and comments.
Thanks [~varun_saxena] for reporting it and [~ozawa] and [~ajisakaa] for review!
